bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 127 (Monday, July 24, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CAREY:H.R. 4828.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to promoteprice transparency for imaging tests under the Medicareprogram.[Page H3896]

item.title: Clinical Laboratory Price Transparency Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.title: Health Care Price Transparency Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 25 - 16.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Imaging Services Price Transparency Act of 2023

item.title: Imaging Services Price Transparency Act of 2023
Imaging Services Price Transparency Act of 2023
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to promote price transparency for imaging tests under the Medicare program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
